trans-unit.source: Create an iOS app on Azure App Service Mobile Apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create an iOS app on Azure App Service Mobile Apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started with using Azure mobile app backends for iOS development in Objective-C or Swift
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started with using Azure mobile app backends for iOS development in Objective-C or Swift

trans-unit.source: Create an iOS app
trans-unit.target: Create an iOS app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use a cloud-based backend service ([Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-value-prop.md)) to an iOS mobile app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use a cloud-based backend service ([Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-value-prop.md)) to an iOS mobile app.

trans-unit.source: You will create a new mobile backend and use a simple _Todo list_ iOS app that stores app data in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You will create a new mobile backend and use a simple _Todo list_ iOS app that stores app data in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An [active Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/)
trans-unit.target: An [active Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/)

trans-unit.source: A PC with [Visual Studio Community 2013] or newer
trans-unit.target: A PC with [Visual Studio Community 2013] or newer

trans-unit.source: A Mac with Xcode v7.0 or newer
trans-unit.target: A Mac with Xcode v7.0 or newer

trans-unit.source: [Azure Mobile iOS framework](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=529823), which is automatically included as part of the quickstart project you download
trans-unit.target: [Azure Mobile iOS framework](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=529823), which is automatically included as part of the quickstart project you download

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure mobile app backend
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure mobile app backend

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a new Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a new Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: You have now provisioned an Azure Mobile App backend that can be used by your mobile client applications.
trans-unit.target: You have now provisioned an Azure Mobile App backend that can be used by your mobile client applications.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will download a server project for a simple "todo list" backend and publish it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will download a server project for a simple "todo list" backend and publish it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Download the server project
trans-unit.target: Download the server project

trans-unit.source: On your PC, visit the [Azure portal].
trans-unit.target: On your PC, visit the [Azure portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** > **Mobile Apps**, and then click the mobile app backend that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** > **Mobile Apps**, and then click the mobile app backend that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the Mobile App blade, click **Settings**, and then under **Mobile App**, click **Quickstart** > **iOS (Objective-C)**.
trans-unit.target: In the Mobile App blade, click **Settings**, and then under **Mobile App**, click **Quickstart** > **iOS (Objective-C)**.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer Swift, click **Quickstart** > **iOS (Swift)** instead.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer Swift, click **Quickstart** > **iOS (Swift)** instead.

trans-unit.source: Configure the server project
trans-unit.target: Configure the server project

trans-unit.source: Download and run the iOS app
trans-unit.target: Download and run the iOS app
